content: systems This type is useful when you need to recover an entire minidisk or an entire DASD volume because of administrative or operational errors, hardware issues, or disaster recovery situations.  Image level backup and recovery of Linux guests These backups can provide for faster recovery if a major failure of a Linux guest or system-wide disaster occurs. For example, you must restore an entire minidisk that is owned by a Linux guest, an entire guest, or one or more DASD volumes that are owned by a Linux guest. Linux-centric solutions can provide file level backup and recovery for Linux guest systems; that is, the solution or its client is running in Linux and understands the file system.
